description: In Kyoto, there are three kinds of residents: humans, raccoon dogs, and tengu. Shimogamo Yasaburou is the third son of the Shimogamo raccoon dog family. His father, Souichirou, had been the head of Kyoto raccoon dog community until he was eaten by the human members of "Friday Club". While taking care of old tengu, fighting with other raccoon dogs, and playing with a psychic human girl, Yasaburou approaches the truth of his father's death.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/3doO4OZ07IlQnOo)

A Japanese gag manga artist. His most famous works are Go!! Southern Ice Hockey Club, Katte ni Kaizou and Sayonara Zetsubou Sensei. His other major works include √P Root Paradise, Sodatte Darling!! and The Sun's Soldier Poka Poka.  

Former Assistants: [Kenjiro Hata](https://anilist.co/staff/100074), [Maeda-kun](https://anilist.co/staff/172154/Maedakun) (also known as MAEDAX, MAEDAX G, MAEDAX Roman)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

Stared his career at [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/Studio-Live). One of the founding members of [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/PA-Works), he is currently Head of the Animation Department at the studio. He became close with [Kenji Kamiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/100348/Kenji-Kamiyama) while working on The Hakkenden, with the two working together on [Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/467/Ghost-in-the-Shell-Stand-Alone-Complex/) where Yoshihara directed the episodes outsourced to P.A. Works. He had his debut as Director with [The Eccentric Family](https://anilist.co/anime/17909/The-Eccentric-Family/).
Milktub is a Japanese music unit consisting of Hiroshi "Bamboo" Takeuchi (竹内博) (vocals, lyrics, composition) and Ichibanboshi Hikaru (一番星☆光) (guitar).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tomihiko_Morimi) | [Blog](https://tomio.hatenablog.com/)
 
A Japanese writer from Nara Prefecture. He graduated from Kyoto University and his works often have Kyoto as the setting.
**Shoutarou Suga** was a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Brother of [Shinya Kawatsura](https://anilist.co/staff/104265/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/145698068)

[Website](http://meganebanchow.com/) | [Blog](http://meganebanchow.jugem.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MeganeBanchow)

Also worked on the music for Denpa Onna to Seishun Otoko as part of the unit Franz Maxwell I.

A four-member Japanese pop band that formed in 2012 as an indie band. After releasing one album independently, they were signed in 2013 to Lantis. They released their debut single "Que Sera Sera" in August 2013. 

Fhána originally formed with [Junichi Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/127344), Yuxuki Waga and Kevin Mitsunaga, and all three had previously been involved in separate indie bands. Fhána did not have a fixed vocalist at first, instead employing guest vocalists to sing the band's songs. Fhána released their independent album New World Line on May 18, 2012 featuring four guest vocalists: Makiko Naka, Towana, IA, and Aoi Tada. In late 2012, Towana joined Fhána as the official vocalist. Fhána was signed to Lantis in 2013 and released their major debut single "Que Sera Sera" on August 21, 2013; the song is used as the ending theme to the 2013 anime series The Eccentric Family (Uchouten Kazoku).

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._
Made his directorial debut with [Katekyou Hitman Reborn!](https://anilist.co/anime/1604/), in which he storyboarded half of the episodes.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/岡村天斎) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tensai_Okamura)

During his university days at Waseda University, Okamura was a part of Waseda's manga research society and together with other budding animators, produced his first independent anime there. Upon graduating from university, Okamura joined the animation production studio Madhouse as an animator through the recommendation of a friend. Lensman was the first series he worked on as an animator. The first anime movies that he worked on were Kamui no Ken and Bobby ni Kubittake. 

In 1989, he made his debut as an episode director with Yawara! and soon made his full directorial debut in 1995 with Memories. He later left Madhouse and went freelance, working on several projects along the way.

In 1991, he changed his first name from Yutaka to Tensai.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Lily_20210401)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/HeKSa75)
Affiliated with [ENGI](https://anilist.co/studio/6292/ENGI).
__Fumihiko Suganuma__ is a Japanese animator, episode director, storyboard artist and prop designer.

Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).

Brother of [Shinya Kawatsura](https://anilist.co/staff/104265/).
__Takeyuki Sadohara__ is a Japanese director and storyboard artist.
